author: Josh Noel
title: Odell finally brings its beer to Chicago; IPA is good place to start
text:
Chicago is rife with quality beer made both at home and afar, but Odell Brewing Co. has long been on many of our drinkers' wish lists. Well, wish no more. The Fort Collins, Colo., brewery finally pushed distribution east of the Mississippi River, and landed in Illinois in February. Founded in 1989, Odell is a classic craft brand with a broad and sturdy portfolio. Even in an industry awash in IPAs, Odell's is a particular standout.
In the bottle: If you're looking for a trendy, heavily citrus forward IPA, this isn't the beer for you. Instead, like most quality beers, Odell IPA thrives on its balance. The beer walks a bitter-fruity line, with elements of orange peel and grapefruit pith tied in with notes of grassy pine, a dash of dank resin and just enough of a caramel malt body to tie it all together. Odell IPA also drinks a bit lighter and more refreshingly than its alcohol content.
Alcohol: 7 percent
Pair with: Odell IPA would shine beside something decadent and rich that stands up to its pungency â€” like a thick, juicy hamburger topped with blue cheese.
Find it: Odell IPA is available in six-packs of 12-ounce cans or bottles at better beer stores.
More information: www.odellbrewing.com
